data.question: What is the empirical formula of D-POST-1?
At what temperature was the intensity data for D-POST-1 collected?
What crystal system does D-POST-1 belong to?
What is the space group of D-POST-1?
What is the final R index (I>2s(I)) for D-POST-1?
How many independent reflections were there for D-POST-1?
What is the absorption coefficient of D-POST-1?
What is the density (calculated) of D-POST-1?
Is the structure of POST-1 maintained after N-alkylation?
data.answer: Yes, the overall framework structure of POST-1 remains unchanged upon N-alkylation of the pyridyl groups exposed in the channels.

data.question: Does the catalytic activity of POST-1 decrease upon partial N-methylation of the pyridyl groups?
data.answer: Yes, the catalytic activity of POST-1 is significantly reduced by partial N-methylation of the pyridyl groups exposed in the channels.

data.question: What is the effect of the amount of POST-1 on the rate of transesterification?
data.answer: The rate of transesterification of 2 with ethanol in CCl4 at 27°C decreases as the amount of POST-1 catalyst decreases.

data.question: What demonstrates that the catalysis mainly occurs in the channels of POST-1?
data.answer: The size selectivity observed in the transesterification reactions, where POST-1 catalyzes the reaction much slower or negligibly with alcohols bulkier than ethanol, supports that the catalysis mainly occurs in the channels.

data.question: What is the enantiomeric excess value for the transesterification of 2 with racemic alcohol 3 in the presence of L-POST-1?
Does the pore volume of POST-1 shrink upon N-alkylation with iodomethane (CH3I)?
data.answer: Yes, the pore volume of POST-1 shrinks by 14% upon N-alkylation with iodomethane (CH3I).

data.question: What is the effect of N-alkylation on the stability of POST-1?
data.answer: N-methylated POST-1 has somewhat lower stability than POST-1 itself, as seen in the TGA thermogram.

data.question: What is the unit cell volume of D-POST-1?
What is the formula weight of D-POST-1?
Can the framework structure of POST-1 be confirmed by comparing observed and calculated powder XRD patterns?
data.answer: Yes, the comparison of observed and calculated powder XRD patterns confirms that the structure of microcrystalline POST-1 is the same as that of single crystal POST-1.

data.question: What is the effect of N-alkylation with 1-iodohexane (CH3(CH2)5I) on the pore volume of POST-1?
data.answer: The pore volume of POST-1 shrinks by 60% upon N-alkylation with 1-iodohexane (CH3(CH2)5I).

data.question: Is the catalytic activity of POST-1 affected by the solvent exchange from water molecules to ethanol molecules inside the channels?
data.answer: No, the catalytic activity of POST-1 is not directly affected by the solvent exchange from water molecules to ethanol molecules inside the channels, but freshly prepared POST-1 is soaked in ethanol to perform the solvent exchange before being used as a catalyst.
